metadata.title: CVE-2020-6492 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Use after free in ANGLE in Google Chrome prior to 83.0.4103.97 allowed aremote attacker to potentially perform a sandbox escape via a crafted HTMLpage.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-6492` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 84.0.4147.105-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 84.0.4147.105-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 84.0.4147.105-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 84.0.4147.105-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 84.0.4147.105-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '84.0.4147.105-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
